lenders.name: Gia-Ninh

lenders.name: Zack

lenders.occupational_info: I am a police detective.  I investigate crimes against children.

lenders.name: Tom Cotter
lenders.loan_because: Micro loans are a wonderful way to encourage entrepreneurs around the world. These businesses not only benefit the owners and their families but help build healthy local economies to overcome poverty on a larger scale. I am especially interested in loans that foster sustainability practices, recycling and renewable energy.
lenders.occupational_info:
Tom Cotter is a clean energy advocate, new product developer, social entrepreneur, public speaker, climate educator, activist and ordained minister.

He serves on the board of directors for the International Green Industry Hall of Fame, the Solar Living Institute and Restore Hetch Hetchy.

lenders.name: Emmanuel
lenders.loan_because: I wanna be one to make a difference in someones Life. I Live for helping others and letting others know that someone DOES care.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm simply trying to Live Life to the fullest, Loving without end and helping others with my wisdom and experiences.

lenders.name: Peggy - Littleton, CO
lenders.loan_because: the kindness and generosity of just one person provides a resource that will benefit many people.

lenders.name: Emily
lenders.loan_because: i want to help people in third world countries get back on their feet.

lenders.loan_because: I think this is a great opportunity to help people that are working hard to improve their lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I fix computer hardware and software problems.

lenders.loan_because: I should.

Good luck to all the entrepreneurs!

lenders.name: Chris
lenders.loan_because: I live in the United States of America, one of the easiest countries in the world to get on your feet or change your situation.  That being said I also know what it's like to have absolutly nothing and not able to get any financial help.  We all need help to get started!

lenders.name: Jennifer and Chris
lenders.loan_because: we believe in the power of micro-financing to change the world one entrepreneur at a time.
lenders.occupational_info: We both help organisations to improve their businesses.

lenders.name: Marc
lenders.loan_because: I was in Phnom Penh for a couple of days in 2007, and took a motorcycle ride to Choeung Ek. On the way back to my hotel, the driver told me about how he owned this motorcycle, but sometimes he could borrow his brother-in-law's car to make even more money, transporting bigger groups in comfort. He was curious about life in America, and when he heard that I used to have a car, he got excited and asked if I could loan him money to buy a car, too. Before I could answer, he quickly sketched out a repayment plan, describing month-by-month how much money he would repay me. Of course, I barely had any money (I'd sold the car a while back), let alone the amount he needed, so I had to turn him down. But it left me with the feeling that he could do great things if he had the chance. So, through Kiva, I hope I can finance a few people like him.
lenders.occupational_info: I'm a freelance writer in Chicago.

lenders.name: Reilly
lenders.occupational_info: I help people deal with emotional issues they're facing.

lenders.name: Leslie
lenders.loan_because: I wish for people to get ahead...have some choices, and  to be given a chance to try...
lenders.occupational_info: I travel between hospitals in our region to share education sessions with nurses on new equipment/supplies and procedures  needed for women and child care focus.  I move information from research into practice... to benefit the care of our patients.  I write learning packages within my expertise, to prepare new staff for their roles .

lenders.name: Vittorio
lenders.loan_because: We don't have to have much, it's what we do with what we have that really matters.

lenders.occupational_info: I had the privilege to serve as a Kiva Fellow with four very different partner lending institutions.  I met many Kiva-funded borrowers to learn how the loans they took impacted their lives, and worked with partner microfinance institutions to build capacity and help them be as successful as possible on Kiva.

lenders.name: Gnosis Lodge
lenders.loan_because: Freemasonry is an ancient system designed to impart morality, ethics and teach mutual service to its members. Instead of lecture or sermon, Freemasonry instructs its members by the performance of ceremonial degrees, each one with its own distinct teachings, symbols and message. Thus the Freemason is taught by experience to serve God, help his fellow man and better himself.
lenders.occupational_info: American Co-Masonry is an organization whose purpose is to provide a guide to its members for their spiritual growth through a series of progressive steps.  Co-Masonry counts among its members men and women of all races, creeds, colors, and nationalities who are 21 years of age or older, have a belief in a Supreme Being, and a desire for more understanding about the spiritual nature of mankind.

lenders.name: Anita
lenders.occupational_info: My name is Anita. I'm 34yrs old, very decent, hardworking, polite and caring. I have a good well located store selling confectioneries, toiletries ect. I I work very hard to take care of my widow mother and also my younger brothers and sister in school. I'm asking for a loan of US $1500 to be able to expand my business to get more goods from branded companies for sale. I'm also a member of a lending group called "Sinapi Aba" and they provide support for each other. The members of the group known each other for a long time. Hope my humble request will meet your favorable consideration.

lenders.loan_because: Throughout life, everyone needs a hand from time to time. I have been supported by numerous individuals and organizations and feel it is an honor and privilege to do the same for others.
lenders.occupational_info: I am a health detective. I look for what is affecting individuals' and communities' health. I then figure out what needs to be done to improve their lives.

lenders.name: FELC
lenders.loan_because: We believe that supporting entrepreneurs in developing countries is important work that leads to stronger nations, stronger families and a stronger economy world-wide.  We loan because we believe we have a responsibility to give back and to spread ethical and principled free enterprise.
lenders.occupational_info: We are a part of the Free Enterprise Leadership Challenge, a summer camp hosted in North Carolina each year.  During FELC, students work in small groups to create a product or service for other members of the camp.  At the end of the week students can choose to keep the money or help developing entrepreneurs through Kiva.org

lenders.occupational_info: I educate students with disabilities.

lenders.name: Markus
